materials.name: Instructor Information
materials.description: Instructor: Jonathan Johannsen. Email: jjohannsen1@mtsac.edu. Office Phone: (909) 274-4669. Office Location: 61-1612. Office Hours: Monday/Wednesday from 12:15 – 1:45pm, and Tuesday/Thursday from 8:40 – 9:10am.

materials.name: Course Policies and Resources
materials.description: Covers attendance, lab activities, late submission policy, grading, academic integrity, accommodations, tutoring services, and other campus resources.

materials.name: Textbook and Required Software
materials.description: Textbook: Assembly Language for x86 Processors Eighth Edition by Kip Irvine, ISBN 9780136681649. Software: Access to a Windows computer with Microsoft Visual Studio 2022 community edition installed.

materials.name: Lecture: Aug 26
materials.description: Topic: Introduction, Basic Concepts, Data Representation. Lab: Binary Conversions. Chapter 1.

materials.name: Lecture: Aug 28
materials.description: Topic: Data Representation. Lab: Binary Subtraction and Two's Complement. Chapter 1.

modules.module_name: Week 2: Data Representation and x86 Architecture

assignments.name: Homework #1 Assigned
assignments.description: Homework #1 is assigned. It will involve writing small segments of assembly language code by hand.

materials.description: Topic: x86 Processor Architecture. Lab: Identifying Computer Components. Chapter 2.

quiz_assignments.name: Quiz #1
quiz_assignments.description: First scheduled quiz, consisting of multiple choice, true/false, and short answer questions.

materials.description: Topic: Assembly Language Fundamentals. Lab: Handwriting Assembly Language Code. Chapter 3.

assignments.name: Project #1 Assigned
assignments.description: First of three projects assigned. Involves creating a complete working program in assembly language.

quiz_assignments.description: First midterm exam, containing a written portion and a programming portion.
